meanings.definition: Relating to the sky or the heavens.
meanings.sent1: The supernal stars twinkled in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The painter captured the supernal beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The supernal clouds seemed to dance in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a supernal quality that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The supernal glow of the moon illuminated the landscape.

meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a supernal dish that delighted everyone.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's performance was truly supernal, breaking records.
meanings.sent3: The supernal aroma of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His intelligence was supernal, solving complex problems effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The supernal strength of the superhero saved the city from disaster.

meanings.definition: Existing or originating beyond the material world.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of supernal beings that watch over us.
meanings.sent2: The mystic claimed to have visions of supernal realms.
meanings.sent3: The supernal energy in the room made everyone feel peaceful.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were filled with supernal landscapes and creatures.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact seemed to hold a supernal power within.
